result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle L Miller in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Michelle L Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work and childcare. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
- No possession of firearms
- Complete a Firearm Safety Course
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of her right to appeal.

Defendant Michelle L Miller not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Michelle L Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear, was in a car accident. Court waives defendant's appearance. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michelle L Miller in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Michelle L Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to a different Reserve Judge, Br. 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle L Miller in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard off the record due to technical issues.
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michelle L Miller in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/12/22 @ 2:30p
